channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Columbia’s University Senate Is Said to Consider Less Severe Action Against Its President
item.description: Worried about the repercussions of a censure vote, the group may offer a watered-down proposal.

item.title: ‘We’re Aware of the Location’: Aid Groups in Gaza Coordinated With I.D.F. but Still Came Under Fire
item.description: Visual evidence and internal communications obtained by The Times show six aid groups based in Western countries, including Israel’s strongest allies, had humanitarian sites hit by Israeli strikes, even after the locations were shared with the I.D.F.

item.title: Jamie Dimon says America needs to ‘take a deep breath’ before facing off with China, because the U.S. is actually in a ‘very good position’ to negotiate
item.description: "We have all the food, water and energy we need."

item.title: Harvey Weinstein Conviction Thrown Out
item.description: New York’s highest appeals court has overturned the movie producer’s 2020 conviction for sex crimes, which was a landmark in the #MeToo movement.

item.title: The Harley Riders With a Taste for Tea and Apple Strudel
item.description: The Harley Owners Group in Alice Springs is what’s known as a social motorcycle club, with the emphasis on social.

item.title: Huawei reportedly keeps getting advanced chips, even as the U.S. tries to tighten the screws on China's semiconductor industry
item.description: Huawei's latest smartphone, the Pura 70, features another advanced chip according to a teardown by the consultancy TechInsights.

item.title: Blinken meets Xi, and Supreme Court Considers Presidential Immunity
item.description: Plus, Haiti gets a new government.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Army Begins Work on Floating Pier Meant to Get More Aid to Gaza, U.S. Says
item.description: Defense Department officials said the structure, which is expected to be completed in early May, could help relief workers deliver as many as two million meals a day.

item.title: Walmart CEO started his career unloading trailers at the warehouse
item.description: Walmart's CEO went from earning $6.50 an hour to $25 million a year—here are his three tips for climbing the corporate ladder like him

item.title: Xi Meets Blinken With Tough Issues on the Agenda
item.description: The direct meeting with China’s leader is a sign of continued effort to ease tensions, but officials expect little progress on core issues like Taiwan, trade and Chinese support of Russia.

item.title: Treasures From the Titanic Are Up for Auction, Exciting Collectors
item.description: Numerous artifacts from the Titanic, including a violin case, are up for auction this weekend in England. Collectors are ready to pounce.

item.title: Aviation results: European carriers EasyJet and Jet2 fly to new heights, while Airbus prepares to overtake Boeing as headwinds continue
item.description: It's been an eventful few days for aviation players—from Airbus to Heathrow. Here's how they fared.

item.title: This Whole King Trump Thing Is Getting Awfully Literal
item.description: The former president’s claim that he has absolute immunity for criminal acts taken in office as president is an insult to reason.

item.title: Xi Meets Blinken With Tough Issues on the Agenda
item.description: The direct meeting with China’s leader is a sign of continued effort to ease tensions, but officials expect little progress on core issues like Taiwan, trade and Chinese support of Russia.

item.title: The financial services gender pay gap in Europe is so large
item.description: Just 183 out of 2,017 people earning more than $1.1 million were female in 2022.
